q: If you can change your mind, you can change your life.
h:
“If you can change your mind, you can change your life.” —
William James

q: You don't need a weatherman to know which way the wind blows.
h:
“You don't need a weatherman to know which way the wind blows.” —
Bob Dylan

q: Show up even when you don't want to show up.
h:
“Show up even when you don't want to show up.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.
h:
“Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.” —
Oscar Wilde

q: Forever is composed of now's.
h:
“Forever is composed of now's.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: He who hesitates is a damned fool.
h:
“He who hesitates is a damned fool.” —
Mae West

q: Happiness depends on your mindset and attitude.
h:
“Happiness depends on your mindset and attitude.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: If you're not failing every now and again, it's a sign you're not doing anything very innovative.
h:
“If you're not failing every now and again, it's a sign you're not doing anything very innovative.” —
Woody Allen

q: Freeing oneself from words is liberation.
h:
“Freeing oneself from words is liberation. ” —
Bodhidharma

q: All I can do is be me, whoever that is.
h:
“All I can do is be me, whoever that is.” —
Bob Dylan

q: The season of failure is the best time for sowing the seeds of success.
h:
“The season of failure is the best time for sowing the seeds of success. ” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: Change is inevitable but personal growth is a choice.
h:
“Change is inevitable but personal growth is a choice.” —
Bob Proctor

q: Live the moment for the moment.
h:
“Live the moment for the moment.” —
Michael Jordan

q: We lie the loudest when we lie to ourselves.
h:
“We lie the loudest when we lie to ourselves.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: People don't realize that now is all there ever is; there is no past or future except as memory or anticipation in your mind.
h:
“People don't realize that now is all there ever is; there is no past or future except as memory or anticipation in your mind.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: You can't go forward and backwards at the same time.
h:
“You can't go forward and backwards at the same time.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Do not ignore the passion that burns in you. Spend time to discover your gift.
h:
“Do not ignore the passion that burns in you. Spend time to discover your gift.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Do not look upon this world with fear and loathing. Bravely face whatever the gods offer.
h:
“Do not look upon this world with fear and loathing. Bravely face whatever the gods offer.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: Tradition is the illusion of permanence.
h:
“Tradition is the illusion of permanence. ” —
Woody Allen

q: A hero is an ordinary person doing things in an extra ordinary way.
h:
“A hero is an ordinary person doing things in an extra ordinary way.” —
Christopher Reeve

q: If you put yourself in a position where you have to stretch outside your comfort zone, then you are forced to expand your consciousness.
h:
“If you put yourself in a position where you have to stretch outside your comfort zone, then you are forced to expand your consciousness.” —
Unknown

q: Adults are just children who earn money.
h:
“Adults are just children who earn money.” —
Kenneth Branagh

q: No great discovery was ever made without a bold guess.
h:
“No great discovery was ever made without a bold guess. ” —
Isaac Newton

q: Character is the result of two things: mental attitude and the way we spend our time.
h:
“Character is the result of two things: mental attitude and the way we spend our time.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: Nothing brings down walls as surely as acceptance.
h:
“Nothing brings down walls as surely as acceptance.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Life is much more successfully looked at from a single window.
h:
“Life is much more successfully looked at from a single window.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: Life is about not knowing and then doing something anyway.
h:
“Life is about not knowing and then doing something anyway.” —
Mark Manson

q: The fact of the matter is that there will be nothing learned from any challenge in which we don't try our hardest.
h:
“The fact of the matter is that there will be nothing learned from any challenge in which we don't try our hardest.” —
Josh Waitzkin

q: If you truly love Nature, you will find beauty everywhere.
h:
“If you truly love Nature, you will find beauty everywhere. ” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: Every poem should remind the reader that they are going to die.
h:
“Every poem should remind the reader that they are going to die.” —
Edgar Allan Poe

q: Success is an iceberg.
h:
“Success is an iceberg.” —
Unknown

q: You give but little when you give of your possessions. It is when you give of yourself that you truly give.
h:
“You give but little when you give of your possessions. It is when you give of yourself that you truly give.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: Receive without pride, let go without attachment.
h:
“Receive without pride, let go without attachment.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: I didn't get there by wishing for it or hoping for it, but by working for it.
h:
“I didn't get there by wishing for it or hoping for it, but by working for it.” —
Estee Lauder

q: It does not matter how slowly you go so long as you do not stop.
h:
“It does not matter how slowly you go so long as you do not stop.” —
Confucius

q: Everybody has talent, but ability takes hard work.
h:
“Everybody has talent, but ability takes hard work.” —
Michael Jordan

q: Never let the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game.
h:
“Never let the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game.” —
Babe Ruth

q: Success is about doing the right thing, not about doing everything right.
h:
“Success is about doing the right thing, not about doing everything right.” —
Gary Keller

q: Some people find fault like there is a reward for it.
h:
“Some people find fault like there is a reward for it. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: If you realize that you're the problem, then you can change yourself, learn something and grow wiser. Don't blame other people for your problems.
h:
“If you realize that you're the problem, then you can change yourself, learn something and grow wiser. Don't blame other people for your problems.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Every failure brings with it the seed of an equivalent success.
h:
“Every failure brings with it the seed of an equivalent success.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Do all things with love.
h:
“Do all things with love.” —
Og Mandino

q: By the practice of meditation, you will find that you are carrying within your heart a portable paradise.
h:
“By the practice of meditation, you will find that you are carrying within your heart a portable paradise.” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: Make no small plans for they have no power to stir the soul.
h:
“Make no small plans for they have no power to stir the soul.” —
Niccolo Machiavelli

q: To find yourself, think for yourself.
h:
“To find yourself, think for yourself.” —
Socrates

q: No duty is more urgent than that of returning thanks.
h:
“No duty is more urgent than that of returning thanks.” —
James Allen

q: If you only knew the magnificence of the 3, 6, and 9, then you would have a key to the universe.
h:
“If you only knew the magnificence of the 3, 6, and 9, then you would have a key to the universe.” —
Nikola Tesla

q: It always seems impossible until it's done.
h:
“It always seems impossible until it's done.” —
Nelson Mandela

q: Your life does not get better by chance, it gets better by change.
h:
“Your life does not get better by chance, it gets better by change.” —
Jim Rohn

q: The sculptor produces the beautiful statue by chipping away such parts of the marble block as are not needed - it is a process of elimination.
h:
“The sculptor produces the beautiful statue by chipping away such parts of the marble block as are not needed - it is a process of elimination.” —
Elbert Hubbard
